Description: Round-topped limestone stela of Ptolemy IV divided into three registers: 1 - Winged sun-disc with pendent uraei. 2 - Scene of the king worshipping to Amun-Ra, Horus, Isis, Sekhmet and Harpocrates; row of stars above. 3 - Two mirror-image scenes of the king worshipping Horus as a falcon wearing the double crown. Hieroglyphic text in all registers; Demotic text at the bottom(now erased).
Curator's comments: Published: Vleeming, Studia Demotica 5, No. 137, p. 101. Mosher, Catalogue of the Books of the Dead in the BM: The Papyrus of Hor, (2001), p.31, 34.
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Ptolemy IV Philopator
